element.name: Howth Castle by kazidrat, Unknown Cache (2.5/1.5)
element.description: This is a small cache, which is located on the grounds of the Howth Castle. The coordinates above are for reference only. For the real coordinates you will need to answer some questions. Please rehide it carefully to prevent muggles from discovering its location.

long-description.p: Howth Castle lies close to the village of Howth, north of the city of Dublin. It is the ancestral home of the line of the Earl of Howth, now held by their heirs, the Gaisford St. Lawrence family. The current building is not the original Howth Castle. It was restyled by the great English architect Sir Edwin Lutyens. The grounds are noted for the wild rhododendron gardens. There are planted about 2 000 varieties of rhododendrons.
The castle itself is not open to the public.

Q 1. In what year did the pirate Grace O'Malley achieved for the gates to be opened to unexpected visitors, and to set an extra place at every meal, by abducting the grand son and heir of the 8th Baron Howth?
Answer = A

Q 2. In the grounds of the Howth Castle is located The National Transport Museum of Ireland. There is exhibited the restored Hill of Howth Tram - what number is it?
Answer = B

Q 3. Electric double-decker tramcars ran the five-mile route from Sutton station via Howth Summit down into Howth railway station - how many years were the trams in operation?
Answer = C (simply substract)

Q 4. On the grounds of Howth Caste lies a huge megalithic monument / portal tomb - what is its name? Count the letters
Answer = D

Q 5. What type of single-chamber megalithic tomb is this? Count the letters
Answer = E

Q 6. Deer Park Hotel Golf & Spa is also situated in the grounds of Howth Castle and boasts Ireland's largest golf complex, all created by well-known architect - what is his name? Count all letters (first and last name)
Answer = F

Q 7. What is the name of the flower which was adopted by the Spa at Deer Park as its emblem? Number of words
Answer = G
Now that you have all the answers, you can calculate the final coordinates using the following math exercise.

element.additional-waypoints:
FL1VDTJ - Final location
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
PA1VDTJ - Parking area
N 53° 22.874 W 006° 04.669

ul.li:
2010-05-21T20:24:40Z : Found it by Crannyn
Lovely morning caching with hollmanr. They did all the calculations(again) but definately a joint effort finding it.Had a well deserved lunch in Brass Monkey' restaurant in the harbour .IN _ magnet TFTC

2010-05-21T19:00:00Z : Found it by hollmanr
Had the questions and co-ordinates worked out a few months ago but the golf course crossing was putting us off. Went up this morning with crannyn and there weren't too many golfers about. We talked to a man who was working at the DeerPark and he said it was fine to walk along the side of the golf course as long as we let the golfers tee off. So off we went, met no golfers and found the cache with the hint. Took Wooden Geocoin and left large dice and nintendo ds game case. We came back a different way - so it is possible to reach the cache location without walking over the golf course which could be awkward at the weekends when its very busy. The path/track starts at the back of the tennis courts. Go initially right and then follow the track and head straight up towards the reservoir. Once you get to the reservoir there is a track leading around it that brings you the cache area. Abundance of wild garlic there today amongst the trees - very pretty. SL TFTC.

2010-03-28T19:00:00Z : Found it by Spark_ie
Had the co-ords worked out for this one a while ago, but today was my first time in Howth since. I was a bit wary walking to the cache, as it didn't feel right walking up the pitch and putt course, but when I saw people playing with their dogs etc, I figured I was alright [:)] Got to the cache location no problems, and spotted the cache from a-high.. Snuck around the corner to sign the log as some players were teeing off !! TFTC, Spark_ie

2010-03-12T20:00:00Z : Write note by Moonshiner Extraordinaire
After finding “Chocolate Soup II”, we decided to look for this cache. However, there were NO information boards to get the information required. My sister Anna was dismayed and disappointed at that (I was more like outraged). I went to the nearby transport museum (which was closed) and to the hotel… It seems the questions have to be answered BEFORE you come here! I was caught out like this at a cache in Spain last year, and I wasn’t pleased to ‘find’ another such cache… It could easily have said so on the cache page. Even though the transport museum was closed, outside it I discovered what I thought was a ‘Timoney’ armoured personnel carrier (Irish designed and built for the Irish army, imagine). It must be 30 years since I had my hands on one of them (the good old days). As ‘Arnie’ said “I’ll be back” – some day.
Moonshiner X

2010-03-09T20:00:00Z : Didn't find it by orangetigerprawn
I tried searching for this in vain. I had the final coordinates worked out some time back, just waiting for the right occasion. The GPS was a bit all over the place with plenty hiding places. I'll try again some other day.

wpt.name: GC1VDTJ
wpt.desc: Howth Castle by kazidrat, Unknown Cache (2.5/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Howth Castle
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: This is a small cache, which is located on the grounds of the Howth Castle. The coordinates above are for reference only. For the real coordinates you will need to answer some questions. Please rehide it carefully to prevent muggles from discovering its location.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Howth Castle lies close to the village of Howth, north of the city of Dublin. It is the ancestral home of the line of the Earl of Howth, now held by their heirs, the Gaisford St. Lawrence family. The current building is not the original Howth Castle. It was restyled by the great English architect Sir Edwin Lutyens. The grounds are noted for the wild rhododendron gardens. There are planted about 2 000 varieties of rhododendrons.

The castle itself is not open to the public.

Quiz:

Q 1. In what year did the pirate Grace O'Malley achieved for the gates to be opened to unexpected visitors, and to set an extra place at every meal, by abducting the grand son and heir of the 8th Baron Howth?
Answer = A

Q 2. In the grounds of the Howth Castle is located The National Transport Museum of Ireland. There is exhibited the restored Hill of Howth Tram - what number is it?
Answer = B

Q 3. Electric double-decker tramcars ran the five-mile route from Sutton station via Howth Summit down into Howth railway station - how many years were the trams in operation?
Answer = C (simply substract)

Q 4. On the grounds of Howth Caste lies a huge megalithic monument / portal tomb - what is its name? Count the letters
Answer = D

Q 5. What type of single-chamber megalithic tomb is this? Count the letters
Answer = E

Q 6. Deer Park Hotel Golf & Spa is also situated in the grounds of Howth Castle and boasts Ireland's largest golf complex, all created by well-known architect - what is his name? Count all letters (first and last name)
Answer = F

Q 7. What is the name of the flower which was adopted by the Spa at Deer Park as its emblem? Number of words
Answer = G

Now that you have all the answers, you can calculate the final coordinates using the following math exercise.

N 53°(B+F+G). (A-(B+F+D+E+G)) / 2

W 006°04.(CxE)+(FxG)+(E+D)

Additional Waypoints

FL1VDTJ - Final location
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

PA1VDTJ - Parking area
N 53° 22.874 W 006° 04.669
